018
019package org.jgrapes.util;
020
021import java.util.Arrays;
022import java.util.Collection;
023import java.util.Collections;
024import java.util.LinkedList;
025import java.util.List;
026import java.util.Map;
027import java.util.Objects;
028import java.util.Optional;
029import java.util.Set;
030import java.util.function.Function;
031import java.util.stream.Collectors;
032import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
033import org.jgrapes.core.Component;
034import org.jgrapes.core.ComponentFactory;
035import org.jgrapes.core.Components;
036import org.jgrapes.core.Event;
037import org.jgrapes.core.Manager;
038import org.jgrapes.core.annotation.Handler;
039import org.jgrapes.util.events.ConfigurationUpdate;
040
041/**
042 * Provides child components dynamically using {@link ComponentFactory}s.
043 * 
044 * An instance is configured with a collection of {@link ComponentFactory}s
045 * (see {@link #setFactories(ComponentFactory...)}) and component 
046 * configurations (see {@link #setPinned(List)} and 
047 * {@link #onConfigurationUpdate(ConfigurationUpdate)}). For each 
048 * configuration where the referenced factory exists, a component is 
049 * created and attached to this component provider as child.
050 * 
051 * The component configurations can be updated by
052 * {@link ConfigurationUpdate} events.
053 * 
054 * @since 1.3
055 */
056@SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
057public class ComponentProvider extends Component {
058
059    /** The entry name for the component's type. */
060    public static final String COMPONENT_TYPE = "componentType";
061    /** The entry name for the component's name. */
062    public static final String COMPONENT_NAME = "name";
063
064    private String componentsEntry = "components";
065    private Map<String, ComponentFactory> factoryByType;
066    private List<Map<?, ?>> currentConfig = Collections.emptyList();
067    private List<Map<?, ?>> pinnedConfigurations = Collections.emptyList();
068
069    /**
070     * Creates a new component with its channel set to this object. 
071     */
072    public ComponentProvider() {
073        this(Channel.SELF);
074    }
075
076    /**
077     * Creates a new component with its channel set to the given 
078     * channel. 
079     *
080     * @param componentChannel the channel that the component's
081     * handlers listen on by default and that 
082     * {@link Manager#fire(Event, Channel...)} sends the event to
083     */
084    public ComponentProvider(Channel componentChannel) {
085        super(componentChannel);
086    }
087
088    /**
089     * Sets the name of the entry in a {@link ConfigurationUpdate} event,
090     * that hold s the information about the components to be provided.
091     * Defaults to "components".
092     *
093     * @param name the name of the entry
094     * @return the component provider for easy chaining
095     */
096    public ComponentProvider setComponentsEntry(String name) {
097        this.componentsEntry = name;
098        return this;
099    }
100
101    /**
102     * Sets the factories that this provider knows about. Only
103     * configurations with a component type that matches one
104     * of the factories are handled by this provider.
105     *
106     * @param factories the factories
107     * @return the component provider for easy chaining
108     */
109    public ComponentProvider setFactories(ComponentFactory... factories) {
110        factoryByType = Arrays.stream(factories).collect(Collectors
111            .toMap(f -> f.componentType().getName(), Function.identity(),
112                (a, b) -> b));
113        synchronize(currentConfig);
114        return this;
115    }
116
117    /**
118     * Sets the pinned configurations. These configurations are
119     * in effect independent of any information passed by
120     * {@link ConfigurationUpdate} events.
121     *
122     * @param pinnedConfigurations the configurations to be pinned
123     * @return the component provider for easy chaining
124     */
125    public ComponentProvider setPinned(List<Map<?, ?>> pinnedConfigurations) {
126        this.pinnedConfigurations = pinnedConfigurations;
127        synchronize(currentConfig);
128        return this;
129    }
130
131    /**
132     * Selects configuration information targeted at this component
133     * from the event. The default implementation invokes 
134     * {@link ConfigurationUpdate#structured(String)} with this
135     * component's path to obtain the information. Called by 
136     * {@link #componentConfigurations(ConfigurationUpdate)}.
137     *
138     * @param evt the event
139     * @return the configuration information as provided by
140     * {@link ConfigurationUpdate#structured(String)} if it exists
141     * 
142     */
143    protected Optional<Map<String, ?>>
144            providerConfiguration(ConfigurationUpdate evt) {
145        return evt.structured(componentPath());
146    }
147
148    /**
149     * Returns the configurations for the components to be provided.
150     * Overriding this method enables derived classes to fully 
151     * control how this information is retrieved from the
152     * {@link ConfigurationUpdate} event.
153     * 
154     * This implementation of the method calls 
155     * {@link #componentConfigurations(ConfigurationUpdate)} to obtain
156     * all configuration information targeted at this component.
157     * It then uses the configured entry 
158     * (see {@link #setComponentsEntry(String)}) to retrieve the information
159     * about the components to be provided.
160     * 
161     * The method must ensure that the result is a collection
162     * of maps, where each map has at least entries with
163     * keys "componentType" and "name", each associated with a
164     * value of type {@link String}.
165     * 
166     * @param evt the event
167     * @return the collection
168     */
169    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidDuplicateLiterals")
170    protected List<Map<?, ?>> componentConfigurations(ConfigurationUpdate evt) {
171        return providerConfiguration(evt)
172            .map(conf -> conf.get(componentsEntry))
173            .filter(Collection.class::isInstance).map(c -> (Collection<?>) c)
174            .orElse(Collections.emptyList()).stream()
175            .filter(Map.class::isInstance).map(c -> (Map<?, ?>) c)
176            .filter(c -> c.keySet()
177                .containsAll(Set.of(COMPONENT_TYPE, COMPONENT_NAME))
178                && String.class.isInstance(c.get(COMPONENT_TYPE))
179                && String.class.isInstance(c.get(COMPONENT_NAME)))
180            .map(c -> {
181                @SuppressWarnings("unchecked") // Checked for relevant entries
182                var casted = (Map<String, String>) c;
183                return casted;
184            })
185            .collect(Collectors.toList());
186    }
187
188    /**
189     * Uses the information from the event to configure the
190     * provided components.
191     * 
192     * @param evt the event
193     */
194    @Handler
195    public void onConfigurationUpdate(ConfigurationUpdate evt) {
196        synchronize(componentConfigurations(evt));
197    }
198
199    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidSynchronizedAtMethodLevel")
200    private synchronized void synchronize(List<Map<?, ?>> requested) {
201        // Calculate starters for to be added/to be removed
202        var toBeAdded = new LinkedList<>(requested);
203        toBeAdded.addAll(pinnedConfigurations);
204        var toBeRemoved = children().stream()
205            .map(c -> Components.manager(c))
206            .collect(Collectors.toCollection(LinkedList::new));
207
208        // Don't attempt to add something that we have no factory for.
209        toBeAdded = toBeAdded.stream()
210            .filter(c -> factoryByType.containsKey(c.get(COMPONENT_TYPE)))
211            .collect(Collectors.toCollection(LinkedList::new));
212
213        // Remove the intersection of "to be added" and "to be removed" from
214        // both, thus leaving what their names say.
215        for (var childIter = toBeRemoved.iterator();
216                childIter.hasNext();) {
217            var child = childIter.next();
218            @SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
219            var childComp = child.component().getClass().getName();
220            var childName = child.name();
221            for (var confIter = toBeAdded.iterator();
222                    confIter.hasNext();) {
223                var config = confIter.next();
224                var confComp = config.get(COMPONENT_TYPE);
225                var confName = config.get(COMPONENT_NAME);
226                if (confComp.equals(childComp)
227                    && Objects.equals(childName, confName)) {
228                    confIter.remove();
229                    childIter.remove();
230                }
231            }
232        }
233
234        // Update children
235        for (var child : toBeRemoved) {
236            child.detach();
237        }
238        toBeAdded.stream().map(config -> {
239            return factoryByType.get(config.get(COMPONENT_TYPE))
240                .create(channel(), config).map(
241                    c -> ComponentFactory.setStandardProperties(c, config))
242                .stream();
243        }).flatMap(Function.identity())
244            .forEach(component -> attach(component));
245
246        // Save configuration as current
247        currentConfig = requested;
248    }
249
250}
